review: First off, with my Amazon Prime, I got my Chromecast the next day I ordered it!As far as the set-up goes, it's fairly easy. Open the package, connect the power source, connect the Chromecast device/dongle to your TV's HDMI port, connect your wi-fi using your smart phone or tablet, and then you're set to view the available applications from your phone/tablet on your TV.I used the USB port from my old LCD to power up my Chromecast. My main purpose for the Chromecast at this time is for Netflix, YouTube, and Pandora. They work seamlessly! Once VuDu is supported, I will definitely use it for that, too!There is few seconds delay/rendering of about 3-8 seconds from when I start casting from my devices before the content plays on my TV.  The device quickly acknowledged (about 1 second) that I was casting content, but since the device need to connect to web to gather the content, it takes the 3-8 seconds before the content plays.One thing you SHOULD NOT DO... do not plug and unplug the device and expect to not give you errors. It gave me an error when I unplugged it from one HDMI port and moved it to another HDMI port.  Apparently, the device needs to complete shut down and boot-up.  So if you that, make sure to unplug the power source, wait about 10 seconds before plugging everything back in.Also, you do not have to unplug the device when turning-off your TV. It will shut off when the TV power is off.Once there are more applications supported, I will/might give it a better rating.
author: N. David

review: This worked once, then it would stream video but no audio. I tried everything and finally called the help desk for google. I waited 20 minutes only to be insulted and treated like an idiot. He asked if I had pressed mute or turned the volume down! Then he told me to take the device out of its port and try another one. As I turned the TV the device broke. The process for replacing this is truly draconian. I stayed on the phone for 45 minutes just so I would have the opportunity to give him a bad review.Now I am waiting for the replacement. They are charging me for this, and it probably still won't work.I am disgusted.
